snippet: More than two dozen Japanese automotive suppliers have agreed to plead guilty to conspiring to fix the prices of parts sold to automakers in the United States and abroad.
abstract: Justice Department says Tokyo-based Bridgestone Corporation has become latest automotive supplier to plead guilty to charges of conspiring to fix prices of parts sold to automakers in the US and abroad; company agrees to pay $425 million criminal fine.
lead_paragraph: More than two dozen Japanese automotive suppliers have agreed to plead guilty to conspiring to fix the prices of parts sold to automakers in the United States and abroad.

headline.main: Bridgestone Admits Guilt in U.S. Price-Fixing Case
headline.print_headline: Bridgestone Admits Guilt in U.S. Price-Fixing Case
